metadata.title: CVE-2020-27170 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.8.kernel/bpf/verifier.c performs undesirable out-of-bounds speculation onpointer arithmetic, leading to side-channel attacks that defeat Spectremitigations and obtain sensitive information from kernel memory, akaCID-f232326f6966. This affects pointer types that do not define aptr_limit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27170` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1111-azure - 4.15.0-1111.123~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.123~14.04.1').
